refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "add-data" : Run Last "axis-changed" : Run Last "changed" : Run Last "moved" : Run Last "resized" : Run Last "update" : Run Last

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkPlot allows to draw high quality scientific plots in two dimensions with a look and feel very similar to Microcal Origin for Windows. The distribution includes GtkPlotCanvas subclass, and a demo program showing two layered plots with different kind of curves. You can choose between a number of symbol types, lines, connectors -straight lines, steps, splines-, and change their attributes -color, size, width. You can also plot functions, add error bars, edit legends, rotate and move axis titles, change axis properties, etc.

refsect2.title: GtkPlotAxis
refsect2.para: The GtkPlotAxis struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: GtkPlotFunc3D ()
refsect2.programlisting: gdouble (*GtkPlotFunc3D) (GtkPlot *plot, GtkPlotData *data, gdouble x, gdouble y, gboolean *error);

refsect2.title: GtkPlotIterator ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*GtkPlotIterator) (GtkPlot *plot, GtkPlotData *data, gint iter, gdouble *x, gdouble *y, gdouble *z, gdouble *a, gdouble *dx, gdouble *dy, gdouble *dz, gdouble *da, gchar **label, gboolean *error);

refsect2.title: enum GtkPlotSymbolType
refsect2.programlisting: typedef enum { GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_NONE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_SQUARE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_CIRCLE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_UP_TRIANGLE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_DOWN_TRIANGLE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_RIGHT_TRIANGLE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_LEFT_TRIANGLE, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_DIAMOND, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_PLUS, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_CROSS, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_STAR, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_DOT, GTK_PLOT_SYMBOL_IMPULSE, } GtkPlotSymbolType;

refsect2.title: The "add-data" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkPlot *plot, GtkPlotData *arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
